item.title: Pietersen England's 'scapegoat' – Richards
item.description: Richards' comments echoed those of retired all-rounder Andrew Flintoff, who also was at a loss to explain his sudden banishment from international cricket

item.title: Yuvraj Singh a big miss, Mitchell Johnson provides right balance: Sanjay Bangar
item.description: Despite failing to secure the services of Yuvraj Singh, Sanjay Bangar feels Punjab can count on in-form Mitchell Johnson to spearhead their IPL-7 campaign

item.title: Sri Lanka cricketers refuse to sign new contracts
item.description: The Sri Lankan board hasn’t met the players’ demand for a 20 per cent share of the revenue for ICC events

item.title: Warner jumps to 5th in ICC rankings after heroics against SA
item.description: David Warner’s 543 runs in 3 Tests against South Africa helped him jump to 5th position in the Test batsmen rankings, while Ryan Harris climbed to 2nd in the top ten Test bowlers list

item.title: Former skippers and players heap praise on Graeme Smith
item.description: Graeme Smith retired from international cricket after the third Test against Australia at Newlands, which the visitors eventually won by 245 runs on Wednesday

item.title: South Africa in no hurry to select new test skipper
item.description: With AB de Villiers the favourite to succeed Smith as Test skipper, CSA chief Haroon Lorgat said their primary focus would be on preparing the team for next month’s World T20

item.title: I compete with myself and not Ashwin, says Harbhajan
item.description: Harbhajan said that he only tries to grow by trying to improve his own performances and doesn’t like to judge the form of other spinners who play for the country

item.title: Meiyappan admits to "friendly betting": Reports
item.description: Fresh trouble for Gurunath Meiyappan with TV reports claiming that he confessed to betting

item.title: Rahane eyes number four slot in World Cup in Australia-NZ
item.description: Despite opening the batting against Afghanistan, Rahane is keen on batting at no.4 for India in the 2015 Cricket World Cup

item.title: Root and Buttler help England to series victory
item.description: England won the last two ODIs of the 3-match contest to seal the series in their favour

item.title: Harris hailed hero as Aussies prevail
item.description: Ryan Harris' incisive bowling turned the tables for Australia and changed the result from what could have been a draw to a thrilling series victory

item.title: Smith wants role in South Africa's future
item.description: Graeme Smith announced his retirement from international cricket midway through the third and final Test match against Australia

item.title: Australia beat SA in epic Test nailbiter
item.description: Australia were made to dig deep for the series victory as they held their nerve to dismiss the hosts on 265 with just 27 balls to go on the final day of the third Test

item.title: Brett Lee says IPL 7 may end India's frustrating hunt for talented pacer
item.description: Despite going unsold in the IPL auction, Lee said he remains a big fan of the money-rich Indian Premier League

item.title: 60-70 per cent of IPL 7 matches to be held in India: Biswal
item.description: Biswal insisted that since IPL is a domestic event, their main objective is to conduct majority of the matches in India
